title: The S&P 500 Closed Out the Week Strong — but Not Strong Enough
text:
The S&P 500 Closed Out the Week Strong — but Not Strong Enough

Andrew Harrer/Bloomberg

Text size

After seesawing for much of this past week, stocks moved higher on Friday, lifted by strong showings in financials, energy, and industrials.

The S&P 500 index flirted with an all-time closing high on Friday, but came up just short. It closed at 3022.55, up 1.2% for the week. The index did trade a little above 3025.86, its record close on July 26, but finished the day a tad below there. Still, it was the third straight week of gains for the index.

“The market is starting to sniff out that global growth is likely stabilizing,” says Keith Lerner, chief market strategist at SunTrust Advisory Services, following concerns of a slowdown. He summed up the week as a “cyclical trade.”
description: After seesawing for much of this past week, stocks moved higher on Friday, lifted by strong showings in sectors such as financials, energy, and industrials. The S&P 500 closed just three points shy of its all-time high.
